meanings.definition: Reduce (something) to fine particles or a spray.
meanings.sent1: The blender atomised the fruits into a smoothie.
meanings.sent2: The machine atomised the paint for an even coat on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally atomised the flour all over the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to atomise the clouds into a misty haze.
meanings.sent5: The explosion atomised the rock into a cloud of dust.

meanings.definition: To break down into small parts or elements.
meanings.sent1: The digestive system helps atomise food for absorption.
meanings.sent2: The strong acids in the lab can atomise metal into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to atomise the playing cards into thin air!

meanings.sent5: The teacher's explanation atomised the complex topic into simple concepts.
